title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 17 february [1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 17 February [1868]
text: Brooklyn 17 Feb. 1868mondayMonday 17dear Walti have got this letter by times it is only half past 12 on mondayMonday and i have got it the one was mailed on sundaySunday i mean and i couldentcouldn't rest contented untilluntil i wrote to let you know i had got it with the 5 dollardollars and i got one on saturdaySaturday with 2 dollerdollars so you see i can stand another snow storm and be comfortable but i dontdon't think it will be much of a storm this time) also i got all the papers last week and have got three to day with the letter the letter man is most too clever the 50 cts and i have given him 25 since) i find giving such people a small sum once in a while does much good and i always say thank you when he gives me a letter i dontdon't know what i would have done yesterday without those papers i had harpersHarper's weekly and the papers so i got through the day quite well) i got a letter from matty to day she likes it very well there now she has got acquainted with some of the boarders one lady invited her out to ride in a beautiful carriage she says she has been so awfullawful homesick she has got over in init in some measure but i expect matt wants to see me she misses me more than she thought she should but when they get keeping house she will get better contented there is a first rate school near where they are going to live so hattee can go i would send the letter but i think she will write to you herself soon well Walt molly hasenthasn't come yet i expected her sure them fine days last week i wrote two letters to her saying in the last one we should expect her the first good day) i wish i could get a letter from han i wrote very particularly about it that you wrote often to her that we supposed she got them but we never heard from her and i wanted her to come this spring and make us a good visit but i have not had any answer)george is away yet i looked some for him yesterday but he didentdidn't come mrs HagemanHegeman where he used to board was buried yesterday i didentdidn't know she was sick till i see her death in the eagleEagle (the old eagle how i dislike it yet i take it if i didentdidn't see any other paper i should think andy was perfection and all the rest was crushed general grant in the bargain) he must be a bad man i like the chronicleChronicle very much) i was in hopes mrs OconorO'Connor had returned for his sake if he is not very well it would probably make him more comfortable) matty says Jeffy is much better there than in brooklynBrooklyn he is in very good spirits and glad they came i have expected davis all last week but he is to come this week matty says) but they will eventually she says settle in brooklyn i hope soon to say something about moovingmoving we are getting rather totoo many in this house for mammasmamma's ideas good luck to you walter dear dontdon't you remember your poor old father always wished that wish to every one good bie LW Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 17 February [1868]
